author: Alex Morales
description: Kemi Badenoch will vow to cut the UK deficit if the Conservatives win the next general election, as she seeks to recover her party’s claim to sound stewardship of the economy.
title: Badenoch Vows to Slash UK Deficit as Tories Focus on Economy

author: Lucy White
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he would resist demands from business to allow more highly skilled workers from India to come to the UK following a free trade agreement between the two countries.
title: Starmer Resists Demands for More Visas for High-Skilled Indians

author: Alex Vasquez, Maya Averbuch
description: Mexican officials vowed to push back against new tariffs the Trump administration is planning on heavy trucks, yet another hurdle the US is throwing in front of its southern neighbor ahead of next year’s review of their trade deal.
title: Mexico Risks a New Tariff Blow on $15 Billion of Truck Exports

author: Courtney McBride
description: Senator Rand Paul said he plans to cosponsor a measure that would prevent the Trump administration from conducting military strikes against suspected drug boats, adding to his condemnation of recent deadly attacks on alleged narco-traffickers in the Caribbean.
title: Rand Paul Backs Effort to Block Military Strikes on Drug Boats

author: Yang Yang, Naomi Ng, K Oanh Ha
description: What Sanae Takaichi’s leadership could mean for Japan’s economy, and why some Japanese aren’t thrilled about the politics of the woman set to become the nation’s first female prime minister.
title: Meet Sanae Takaichi, the Populist Poised to Break Japan’s Glass Ceiling

author: Giang Nguyen
description: Vietnam received its first classification as an emerging equity market from a major index compiler, potentially attracting billions of dollars more in capital inflows.
title: FTSE to Upgrade Vietnam to Emerging-Market Status From Frontier

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration is considering canceling about $12 billion in energy projects, including funding for hydrogen ventures backed by US oil majors, according to a list seen by Bloomberg.
title: Trump Administration Eyes $12 Billion in New Energy Project Cuts

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Capitol influence reporter Caitlin Reilly looks at one Republican bucking her party on Obamacare subsidies. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Greene Opens Small Crack in GOP Unity on Shutdown Deal

author: Ania Nussbaum, Samy Adghirni
description: From across the political spectrum, Emmanuel Macron’s rivals are turning up the pressure on the French president, demanding their choice of prime minister, snap elections and even his resignation.
title: Macron Boxed In by French Rivals After His Prime Minister Quits

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said banks will once again have to contribute to Italy’s budget.
title: Italy’s Banks Should Contribute to Budget, Meloni Tells Rai1

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: A Pentagon review of the AUKUS pact between the US, Australia and the UK is a “brass-tack” evaluation of its affordability and whether the agreement fits with President Donald Trump’s foreign-policy priorities, a Defense Department nominee said.
title: Pentagon Conducting ‘Brass-Tack’ Review of AUKUS, Nominee Says

author: William Horobin
description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said institutions are observing France’s political crisis and hope a government finds a way to adopt a budget.
title: ECB’s Lagarde Says EU Institutions Hope France Finds Budget Path

author: Mark Schroers
description: Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel backed a joint budget for European Union defense spending, suggesting that this could be financed by common debt.
title: Bundesbank Chief Says Joint EU Defense Budget Would Make Sense

author: Brian Platt, Laura Dhillon Kane
description: President Donald Trump said he expects the US and Canada can eventually reach a trade deal, but he remained vague about how and when an agreement might be achieved.
title: Trump Says US and Canada Working on Formula for Tariff Deal

author: Philip Aldrick
description: The UK could reduce inequality and strengthen the public finances by shifting government spending toward investment from welfare, wages and other overheads, the International Monetary Fund said.
title: Invest More, Cut Welfare to Spur UK Growth, IMF Paper Argues

author: William Horobin
description: As the French establishment desperately tried to stitch together its third government in a year, Bruno Le Maire suddenly found himself trying to patch up a long-running feud.
title: French Official Thought New Defense Minister Was a Prank Caller

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Argentina’s Treasury is burning through its dollar deposits to prop up the peso, with traders estimating it has roughly $1 billion left in its coffers.
title: Milei Running Short of Dollars as Argentina Awaits US Lifeline

author: Mark Schroers
description: Germany’s government must step up efforts to tackle the economy’s deep-seated problems and increase its growth potential, Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said.
title: Merz Urged by Bundesbank Chief to Speed Up Reforms for Economy

author: Chris Strohm
description: US Attorney General Pam Bondi clashed with Democratic senators on Tuesday during a politically charged oversight hearing in which lawmakers frequently traded partisan barbs over President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.
title: US Attorney General Defends Trump Moves in Chicago During Tense Senate Hearing

author: Ott Tammik
description: A soldier from Estonia’s voluntary defense organization was sentenced to nearly five years in prison for spying for Moscow after he was caught handing over information about the military presence in a city near the border with Russia.
title: Estonia Finds National Guardsman Guilty of Spying for Russia

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union unveiled fresh tariffs on Tuesday meant to shield its ailing steel sector, taking a page from Donald Trump’s protectionist playbook.
title: EU Boosts Steel Protections With 50% Levy to Sustain Industry

author: Ken Parks
description: The US has removed Paraguay’s former head of state Horacio Cartes from its financial sanctions list amid warmer ties between the Trump administration and the conservative government of President Santiago Pena.
title: US Removes Sanctions on Paraguay’s Ex-President Amid Warmer Ties

author: Beatriz Reis
description: Brazil’s congress pulled back key revenue-raising provisions from tax legislation ahead of Wednesday’s deadline, narrowing the government’s room to balance its fiscal accounts next year.
title: Brazil Scales Back Tax and Budget Proposal Ahead of Deadline

author: Rakesh Sharma, William Standring
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent a warm birthday message to Russia’s Vladimir Putin just hours before Keir Starmer’s arrival, providing an awkward start to a visit meant to be focused on trade.
title: Modi Praises Putin Ties, Starting Starmer Visit on Awkward Note

author: Alex Morales
description: Robert Jenrick urged his Conservative colleagues to fight to regain power at the next UK general election, as he sought to banish memories of the Liz Truss era which helped the party suffer a historical electoral wipeout 15 months ago.
title: Jenrick Says It’s ‘Tough Being a Tory’ as He Urges Fightback

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German lawmakers are set to give the green light to the latest big-ticket item in the nation’s military upgrade with the approval of 20 new Eurofighter jets worth almost €4 billion ($4.7 billion).
title: German Lawmakers to Approve €3.75 Billion Eurofighter Order

author: Abeer Abu Omar
description: Hamas is looking to secure a “fair hostage exchange” as part of a deal with Israel to end the two-year war that’s devastated Gaza and destabilized much of the Middle East.
title: Hamas Says It’s Seeking ‘Fair Hostage Exchange’ in Egypt Talks

author: Brendan Murray
description: The growth of global goods trade is expected to slow sharply next year after a surprisingly resilient first half of 2025, reflecting a delayed drag on international commerce from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs, the World Trade Organization said.
title: WTO Sees Full Impact of US Tariffs Hitting Trade Growth in 2026

author: Lauren Dezenski, John Harney
description: The White House is considering not paying federal employees for days they have been furloughed during the shutdown, according to a person familiar with the matter, a move that could run afoul of a law that mandates workers get backpay once the government re-opens.
title: White House Threatens to Not Pay Workers Furloughed by Shutdown

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Derek Theurer would perform the duties of deputy Treasury secretary, in a statement Tuesday.
title: Bessent Taps Theurer for Deputy Secretary Duties at Treasury

author: Upmanyu Trivedi
description: Nigel Farage was alarmed and appalled after a TikTok influencer threatened to kill the Reform UK party leader and marry his sister, he said at the London trial of a man over the death threats.
title: Farage Tells London Jury TikTok Death Threats Were Appalling

author: Olivia Fletcher, Jennifer Duggan
description: Irish Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe delivered a cautious financial plan for the coming year as he forecast that the country’s enviable budget surplus will drop by half in 2026.
title: Ireland Delivers a Cautious Budget as Surplus Shrinks

author: Ellen Milligan, Alex Wickham
description: Top UK security officials will face questions over an aborted China spying case brought by its chief prosecutor, which collapsed at the same time that it is seeking to rebuild economic ties with the country.
title: UK Security Officials to Face Questions Over Dropped China Case

author: Greg Ryan
description: Business leaders, investors and academics have cheered Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey’s efforts to counter the Trump administration’s research funding cuts with state money — so much so that a recent meeting on the initiative required overflow seating.
title: Massachusetts Effort to Offset Trump’s Research Cuts Stalls

author: John Gittelsohn, Patrick Clark
description: Rick Caruso, the mogul behind Los Angeles’ shopping meccas, lost the mayor’s race in 2022. Rebuilding after the wildfires has suddenly put him in the running for governor.
title: California’s Billionaire Mall King Is Becoming a Real Political Contender

author: William Horobin, Ania Nussbaum, Nayla Razzouk
description: The mission of Sebastien Lecornu, France’s caretaker prime minister, to save Emmanuel Macron’s presidency from a deepening crisis ran into roadblocks Tuesday as several parties showed little appetite for compromise to end the political impasse.
title: Macron’s Last-Ditch Bid for Political Accord Suffers Early Blows

author: Julian Lee
description: Surge in crude shipments coincides with a slump in Russian refinery runs
title: Russian Oil Flows Pushed to the Limit as Drone Strikes Take Toll

author: William Horobin
description: France’s outgoing prime minister, Sebastien Lecornu, said the budget and the overseas territory of New Caledonia are the priorities in crisis talks that aim to restore political stability after his resignation on Monday.
title: France’s Lecornu Says Budget Is Priority in Crisis Talks

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The governor of one of America’s most trade-reliant states has a warning for President Donald Trump: Tariffs are hurting the industries he’s trying to revive.
title: Kentucky Governor Grapples With Tariffs, Says 2028 Call Can Wait

author: Mark Niquette
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has said sweeping away the extensive regulatory burdens hampering domestic manufacturing is an “unheralded” part of Donald Trump’s agenda that would start paying dividends in the third quarter that just ended last week.
title: Trump’s ‘Unheralded’ Deregulation Agenda Divides Economists

author: Alan Crawford
description: But the rush to develop artificial-intelligence infrastructure carries risks.
title: Governments Are Gambling the AI Bet Pays Off

author: Abeer Abu Omar
description: Saudi Arabia is making “uneven” progress on its most ambitious infrastructure projects due to challenges including engineering constraints, a shortfall in private investment and lower oil prices, according to Moody’s Investors Service.
title: Saudi Arabia’s Major Projects in ‘Uneven’ Progress, Moody’s Says

author: Sherif Tarek
description: Deadly clashes broke out between the Syrian army and the US-backed Syrian Democratic Forces in the northern city of Aleppo, highlighting the challenges faced by the new government as it strives for unity following years of civil war.
title: Syria Clashes With US-Backed Armed Group Are Blow to Unity Hopes

author: Catherine Lucey, Erik Wasson
description: With the US government shutdown closing in on the one week mark, President Donald Trump showed signs of cracking Monday, sending mixed messages about the state of talks with Democrats on their biggest demand.
title: Trump Opens Door to Talks GOP Has Resisted as Shutdown Extends

author: Nicholas Lua
description: Shell Plc’s retail pump stations in Indonesia have run out of gasoline for the second time in less than two months as import restrictions by the Southeast Asian nation continue to crimp supplies of the vehicular fuel.
title: Shell’s Gas Stations in Indonesia Run Dry Again as Supplies Drop

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul’s government has green-lit a $1.36 billion consumption stimulus program to boost a weakening economy and its popularity ahead of a general election.
title: Thailand Deploys $1.4 Billion Stimulus to Spur Consumption

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has appointed his ally, Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla, to lead the nation’s independent anti-corruption watchdog.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Appoints Ally as Anti-Graft Watchdog Head

author: Francesca Stevens
description: Vietnam’s capital was brought to a standstill for the second time in two weeks after Storm Matmo dumped prolonged, heavy rains across Hanoi.
title: Vietnam Capital Under Water Again After Storm Matmo Sweeps In

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te urged Donald Trump to continue supporting Taiwan, amid mounting concerns over whether the US president could sacrifice the self-governing democracy’s interests in order to engage with Beijing.
title: Lai Urges Trump to Back Taiwan as Doubts Rise Over US Commitment

author: Rene Vollgraaff, Antony Sguazzin
description: Afrikaners rank among wealthiest South Africans, hold top posts.
title: A Celebration of an Afrikaner Icon Belies Trump’s Genocide Claim

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: The Irish government is to deliver its toughest budget in years in a bid to shield its economy from the threat of declining investment from US firms.
title: Ireland to Deliver Investment Budget to Counter Trump’s Threat

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Sanae Takaichi, who is expected to be Japan’s first female prime minister, appointed former Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki as the ruling party’s new Secretary-General in a sign that she aims to quell concerns about fiscal discipline.
title: Takaichi Names Japan’s Ex-Finance Minister as LDP Secretary General
